entry.name: Ashweaver Recluse
entry.first_emerged: After the Ashfall in Cindertwine Hollows
entry.description: A massive spider-like entity weaving threads of living ash. Its silk burns slowly, creating smoldering traps that linger in the environment.
entry.hue_interaction: Drawn to Vermilion-bound players. Threads can ignite Hue Overload if fire-aspected color pools are too full.
entry.behavior: Creeps near charred architecture. Lays slow-burning web paths. Lures players toward glowing husks to trigger ambushes.
entry.weaknesses: Water-based or frost-attuned skills rapidly extinguish its threads. Susceptible to sudden gust-based spells.
entry.notes: Many believe the Recluse nests within burnt memories. Webs sometimes shimmer with scenes of past ruins.

lore.title: Ashweaver Recluse – The Emberlace Widow
lore.quote: "The threads still burn, but nothing escapes."
flavor_description: Ash-flecked legs move soundlessly across charred stone.
Its eyes gleam like cinders — watching from the smoke.
field_notes: We traced the smoldering silk. It led us nowhere — just ash and echoes.
I heard someone scream. But it was my own voice, from a different fire.
It waits near things lost to flame. As if hoping to weave them whole again.
lore.source: From ‘Ash Paths and Flamewalkers,’ recovered in Cindertwine
